intro: Euphrasia pratensis, commonly known as the meadow eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and opposite leaves that are usually oval or lance-shaped. Euphrasia pratensis is often found in open habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
